publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-234 Scott Barrie: Craig Brown—That the Parliament congratulates Craig Brown on being made a Commander of the British Empire at Buckingham Palace; believes that Mr Brown has assembled a squad of players capable of taking Scotland to the European Championship finals, and offers its support for the forthcoming play-offs against England.

S1M-234 Scott Barrie: Craig Brown—That the Parliament congratulates Craig Brown on being made a Commander of the British Empire at Buckingham Palace; believes that Mr Brown has assembled a squad of players capable of taking Scotland to the European Championship finals, and offers its support for the forthcoming play-offs against England.
S1M-234 Craig Brown (lodged on 27 October 1999) Karen Gillon*

S1M-234 Scott Barrie: Craig Brown—That the Parliament congratulates Craig Brown on being made a Commander of the British Empire at Buckingham Palace; believes that Mr Brown has assembled a squad of players capable of taking Scotland to the European Championship finals, and offers its support for the forthcoming play-offs against England. Supported by: Karen Gillon
S1M-234 Craig Brown (lodged on 27 October 1999) Mr Kenny MacAskill*

S1M-234 Scott Barrie: Craig Brown-That the Parliament congratulates Craig Brown on being made a Commander of the British Empire at Buckingham Palace; believes that Mr Brown has assembled a squad of players capable of taking Scotland to the European Championship finals, and offers its support for the forthcoming play-offs against England. Supported by: Karen Gillon, Mr Kenny MacAskill

S1M-234 Scott Barrie: Craig Brown—That the Parliament congratulates Craig Brown on being made a Commander of the British Empire at Buckingham Palace; believes that Mr Brown has assembled a squad of players capable of taking Scotland to the European Championship finals, and offers its support for the forthcoming play-offs against England. Supported by: Karen Gillon, Mr Kenny MacAskill

S1M-234 Scott Barrie: Craig Brown—That the Parliament congratulates Craig Brown on being made a Commander of the British Empire at Buckingham Palace; believes that Mr Brown has assembled a squad of players capable of taking Scotland to the European Championship finals, and offers its support for the forthcoming play-offs against England. Supported by: Karen Gillon, Mr Kenny MacAskill
